message.content:
cs.SE, cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.LG. 

The paper proposes an approach to the presentation, codification, and reuse of property specifications for finite-state verification. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the software engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. The paper also extends the pattern system with events, which involves the manipulation of variables, indicating that it may also belong to the programming languages (cs.PL) sub-category. The use of formal specifications for realistic systems suggests that the paper may also belong to the logic in computer science (cs.LO) sub-category. The paper deals with the conversion of specifications between formalisms, such as LTL, CTL, QRE, indicating that it may also belong to the formal languages and automata theory (cs.FL) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the presentation of patterns, which may also be relevant to the logic and verification (cs.LG) sub-category.
